meanings.definition: To unite or join together in advance.
meanings.sent1: We will preunite the pieces before starting the project.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preunite the ingredients before baking the cake.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to preunite their efforts for a successful outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her words preunited the divided group, bringing them together.
meanings.sent5: The preunited colors created a beautiful mosaic on the wall.

meanings.definition: To be united or joined together in advance.
meanings.sent1: The parts preunite seamlessly to form a complete structure.
meanings.sent2: The flavors preunite perfectly to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The animals preunite in the forest to plan a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The melodies preunite in harmony, creating a soothing symphony.
meanings.sent5: The ideas preunite in his mind, forming a brilliant solution.
